channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bench loose, 23rd August
item.description:
Bench has 3 pieces of wood missing and the bolts have come off so bench is moving around. Kids are taking the planks out and throwing them around

item.title: Ongoing Obstruction on Pavement, 23rd August
item.description:
Hi team, Despite multiple reports—some dating back to early August—and repeated assurances that the matter is being looked into, the vehicle in question remains in place. It is unacceptable that the pavement continues to be obstructed, posing a serious inconvenience to pram users, wheelchair users, and pedestrians. This prolonged inaction reflects a concerning disregard for your duty of care to the community. The situation is not only frustrating but also dangerous. The vehicle’s presence, along with the precariously leaning TFL post, presents a significant safety hazard. It’s only a matter of time before someone is seriously injured. Please take immediate action to remove the vehicle and address the safety risks. Thank you, A concerned constituent

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Padua Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags left on top of abandoned bins, 23rd August
item.description:
Hello — Someone has flytipped some rubbish on top of the abandoned bins on Wingfield Street near the corner of Maxted Road. This is a frequent flytipping location, so I would appreciate it if this could be resolved promptly. There are also two abandoned bins that have been reported to the council and need to be picked up. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Maxted Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement breaking up badly, 23rd August
item.description:
The pavement on Somerfield Road N4 (between nos 1 and 13) has become quite treacherous, particularly outside no 5. The tree roots along the street have affected the pavement and it is now in a terrible state for pedestrians. It needs urgent repairs
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Somerfield Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Fly tipping of wardrobe door with shattered glass, 23rd August
item.description:

item.title: Recycling bins and garden bins stolen, 23rd August
item.description:
The building has 4 flats with no garden waste bin or recycling bin (stolen). Previously there was only one recycling bin for 4 flats which was not enough. Foxes are opening the bags, flies, it is an obstruction on the path and it is leaving a bad smell.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
